summary: swabs were collected from personnel (nasal mucosa) and their clothes, boots and equipment after contact with calves shedding either virus. a high viral RNA load was detected on 97% (n = 44) of the fomites 24 h after exposure. a high viral RNA load was detected on 97% (n = 26) of the human nasal mucosa swabs. the carriage seems short-lived and the transmission potential is likely limited. high viral loads on contaminates fomites 24 h after exposure to infected animals and detection of infective BCoV.
